message: Even used the QR code on the conventionist website on my phone to download the app
Just started using it
@timols, same here. I'm extremely impressed.
http://conventionist.com/
worked well
If you haven't already, GET IT. It's perfect.
Very nice -> Already scheduled some of the talks I want to check out
+1 I love it since the moment I downloaded it.
The app really needs to consistently order things by room/track in each time slot. Color coding each room/track would also be nice.
Feature Suggestion: sharing schedule between multiple devices
crashed on me and lost my schedule. rather annoying.
i really like it
Wish there was a blackberry version :(
Feature Suggestion: Can the schedule automatically show today's date or remember the last date you looked at.
Near perfect. Would love a landscape mode.
Any Conventionist people at PyCon I can bribe to do an iPad version? Excellent app.
would like to see the room name along with the description / schedule
(nevermind)
Convore works really well
@Zurgy whats wrong with the website on your tablet?
@gpshead absolutely nothing :-) app let's you mark things on the schedule, nothing the website couldn't do. Convoys work
My schedule still hasn't updated, but the old one is has reappeared unharmed.  Whew...

I'd just like them to fix the bugs.  Mine just failed to download the schedule update and it looks like the old schedule was lost.  Hopefully I won't be going through to make a custom schedule for a third time..  (First lost to an app crash)
FYI: You need to go back to the main Conventionist page and re-download the PyCon schedule to get the updated version.  Its not pushed.
Feature suggestion: include location in alert message; looking that up when I get an alert is slow/inefficient.
It's a shame that the app is not aware of changes to the schedule! It should show a popup or just any kind of message!
does updating the schedule clear all of my selected session?
it'd be nice to have other scheduled stuff arrive in conventionist as its scheduled: lightning talks, bofs, etc.
(i suppose if the session are wrong it doesnt add any value to have them selected.  fine)
@danlevine When you update, your selected sessions are unchanged, up to any changes in times.
Wish it downloaded the schedule I already created on the website. :-(
@peterlada how can you get those from the iPad?

Hey guys, creative director behind Conventionist here, if you are getting crashes - so sorry about that, but would love to fix them as we can't replicate some of them. Send us your crash logs! staff@proximalabs.com
It's a bit involved, but you can send us your crash logs thru itunes. When you sync your ipad it should send them, or you should get an alert asking if you want to send diagnostic info.
The app is pretty cool and useful, so definitely thumbs up for it
@peterlada oh awesome I didn't know that was possible
@peterlada fantastic work!

@peterlada Thanks for the app. Would be nice if the schedule would jump right to "now", i.e. current date and time. Also, notifying me when there's an update to the schedule/content is nice, but it would be better if afterward it could summarize specifically what changed. I had some updates where, due to flaky wifi connection, I wasn't sure whether they completed or not and couldn't tell easily if anything had changed.
+1 to the jump to right now, or at least today's date and the room numbers in alerts.  Unless I'm mistaken, mine found the updated schedule and grabbed it for me.
Maybe there ought to be a "What's next" page if people don't want the "jump to date" feature.

Thanks for the comments guys. Having the app jump to the current day works in Android, and is coming for iPhone. Updates I agree are very rudimentary at the moment, and is something we are working on fleshing out. We definitely want to have update notes in the alert at the very least, but improving the whole process is something we are working on.
And there should certainly be push notifications for schedule alterations.

Hmm, perhaps a module for upcoming schedule items, etc. The problem with jumping to the date/time is that you have to balance that against people who would be annoyed with it jumping there every time.
To expand on @Zurgy's comment; The app should definitely load into the current date and probably even the current time. The app is most useful for finding out what is next.

Re: push notifications for schedule alterations - right now we push a notification when there is an update, but only when you are on the home page, and it only checks once an hour. I imagine having a change log (schedule changes, etc) which you can view when prompted to update might be a solution. Schedule sessions change so often that we have to bulk update them, again a balance against being accurate and annoying.

When downloading an update failed (wifi on an iPhone 4 was flaky), the entire schedule would disappear from the conference page, making it impossible to use the old version.  At some point after leaving/coming back to the app, it would magically re-appear, but it was pretty annoying (and frightening the first time).
Having the app remember where you were last looking in the schedule might be a good middle-ground

@jaaaarel That is quite strange... the update is essentially just re-downloading the guide, which doesn't unpack (and overwrite the existing guide) until its finished downlaoding. If it fails, it *should* just continue to use the existing guide. Will look into it, thanks.
@peterlada I can second jaaaarel's experience; I mentioned it earlier in the thread.
Me too
Please and iPad native version. I'm tired of typos from the huge keyboard
@peterlada happened to me too
